Ulman explicitly denied the widely circulated rumor that she was illegally accessing locations for E&P, confirming that she "paid for the hotels" used in the performance. She focused immense effort on meticulously staging the affluent interiors to convincingly replicate the consumerist fantasy promoted by privileged social media feeds. This directly contradicts
Dean Kissick's 2014 article published in iD magazine, which descibes Amalia Ulman "sneaking into luxury hotels to take selfies."
